subs.text: August 6
The Marine Corps sees its individuals and units as vulnerable to information warfare and wants to develop media literacy training. [link]
subs.rawText: The Marine Corps sees its individuals and units as vulnerable to information warfare and wants to develop media literacy training. https://t.co/GmEHn9vdhd

subs.text: August 4

Done right, stories on radio rev up a listener's imagination. Suspense works beautifully, too. When a yellow wasp lands on the infant's cheek and begins to clean its forelegs one against the other, you feel the peril. Most radio programming tosses those resources out the window. [link]
subs.rawText:
Done right, stories on radio rev up a listener's imagination. Suspense works beautifully, too. When a yellow wasp lands on the infant's cheek and begins to clean its forelegs one against the other, you feel the peril.

Most radio programming tosses those resources out the window. https://t.co/CtqM73fjEc

subs.text: Correction from local authorities. The car with the solo driver was headed south, not north, and it was not that car but the other one, carrying the elected official and two staff members, heading north, not south, that crossed the highway's dividing line. [link]
subs.rawText: Correction from local authorities. The car with the solo driver was headed south, not north, and it was not that car but the other one, carrying the elected official and two staff members, heading north, not south, that crossed the highway's dividing line. https://t.co/uK8bVEeUPY

subs.text: Knitting and other textile practices are "meaning-making activities" that connect "back to the efforts of our earliest ancestors to find 'system and story' in their worlds (Dissanayake 2000, 86)." [link]

subs.text: "And you can almost taste the pressure now. Koufax lifted his cap, ran his fingers through his black hair, then pulled the cap back down, fussing at the bill. Krug must feel it too as he backs out, heaves a sigh . . ." Vin Scully calls the perfect game. [link]

subs.text: In a deeply segregated country or world, certain places relax social barriers enough for our shared humanity to show itself. For Malcolm X, that was Mecca, and for Akhil Sharma, Disney World. [link]
subs.rawText: In a deeply segregated country or world, certain places relax social barriers enough for our shared humanity to show itself. For Malcolm X, that was Mecca, and for Akhil Sharma, Disney World. https://t.co/cfuFlP93w1

subs.text: In 1990, an amendment was proposed to the Indiana Constitution: “A woman may not be compelled to complete or terminate her pregnancy.” [link]
subs.rawText:
In 1990, an amendment was proposed to the Indiana Constitution:

“A woman may not be compelled to complete or terminate her pregnancy.” https://t.co/zUZCJWxGxy

subs.text: “Indiana legislators have rarely allowed Hoosiers to speak on ballot questions.” (And stir in the gerrymandered one-party supermajority in both the House and Senate.) [link]

subs.text: August 3
Abortion bans in red states "are often an expression not of democratic wishes, but of lawmakers’ insulation from democratic accountability." [link]
subs.rawText: Abortion bans in red states "are often an expression not of democratic wishes, but of lawmakers’ insulation from democratic accountability." https://t.co/7uoBGTq0q7

subs.text: "The stunning result in an abortion referendum in Kansas on Tuesday, however, shows that even in a very red state, bans cannot necessarily survive contact with democracy." [link]
subs.rawText: "The stunning result in an abortion referendum in Kansas on Tuesday, however, shows that even in a very red state, bans cannot necessarily survive contact with democracy." https://t.co/7uoBGTq0q7

subs.text: Families, friends, and community members are shaken by the loss of four Hoosier residents in a car accident near Nappanee today, including IN-2nd U. S. House District Representative Jackie Walorski.
subs.rawText: Families, friends, and community members are shaken by the loss of four Hoosier residents in a car accident near Nappanee today, including IN-2nd U. S. House District Representative Jackie Walorski.

subs.text: Arlo Guthrie talks about being proud of American music and sings "I Can't Help Falling In Love With You." [link]

subs.text: Universities disincentivize faculty from learning how to speak and write well for wide audiences. In doing so, public universities give taxpayers less than they have paid for. And some faculty grow vain: “Those people on the outside could never handle our best ideas . . .” [link]
subs.rawText:
Universities disincentivize faculty from learning how to speak and write well for wide audiences.

In doing so, public universities give taxpayers less than they have paid for.

And some faculty grow vain: “Those people on the outside could never handle our best ideas . . .” https://t.co/R3JuFRGvh5

subs.text: Too far for the phone’s camera, but on our walk yesterday there was a bald eagle having a drink of water on the far bank of the St. Joseph River in South Bend, Indiana, right in town, a ten minute walk from the house. A first for our nearly three decades in this city. [link]
subs.rawText: Too far for the phone’s camera, but on our walk yesterday there was a bald eagle having a drink of water on the far bank of the St. Joseph River in South Bend, Indiana, right in town, a ten minute walk from the house. A first for our nearly three decades in this city. https://t.co/d7EcrZjgkt

subs.text: James Baldwin’s figurative language was so compact and insightful. Americans caught in “a labyrinth of attitudes,” unable to “renew themselves at the fountain of their lives…” The Fire Next Time [link]

subs.text: August 1

Countdown to Hiroshima: Daily blog posts recount the final weeks and days of thought and action leading to the two atomic bombings, including the morally dubious political games being played in Washington. [link]

subs.text: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs [link]
subs.rawText: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU

subs.text: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." [link]
subs.rawText: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." https://t.co/RCFBitNU6G

subs.text: Rhythm N Roots streams 9 to noon (Central) weekday mornings on KXCV-KRNW. Songs I never hear around northern Indiana. Some Zydeco, Cajun, hip Country, and I don't know what all. [link]

subs.text: "When you look back, his message was so humanistic, how could it possibly have seemed so radical? He was singing for equality and freedom and the end of war." --Michael Schumacher recalling Phil Ochs [link]

subs.text: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
subs.rawText: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
